intro: Codonoboea kolokensis, commonly known as the Kola codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive corolla shape. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
